title: "Your browser is being managed by your organization."
content:
Under Mozilla Settings, there is a notification at the top of the page saying "Your browser is being managed by your organization." Upon clicking, it shows: "Policy Name: Certificates", "Policy Value: ImportEnterpriseRoots", "true".

I am familiar with this notification from using Mozilla on my work laptop, but this is now showing on my personal laptop. Can you clarify what this is? I don't want to grant my employer right to manage my browsing on personal laptop, if that is what is happening. Not sure if this is because I synced settings with my browser login on the work laptop or what...
creator: connorhedges16

title: firefox update breaks my keyboard
content: firefox just forced an update and now i can't type more than one key at a time. like shift, shift is a really helpful key for capitalizing. this is a super cause effect situation. if firefox is closed, it doesn't happen. it happened right after firefox crashed and updated itself. this happens across my pc, not just firefox. i guess i'm forced back to chrome

title: Firefox can't reopen after closing when multiple extensions are enabled
content:
Since upgraded to 138.0.1 my Firefox browser can't reopen after closing when multiple extensions are enabled. If run in safe mode or have all extensions disabled it can close and reopen correctly but when more extensions enabled firefox.exe will stay in background after closing and I can only reopen it after ending the process in task manager. It has never happened before.

Here attached all the extensions I have enabled.
creator: lullula889

title: themes not working
content:
Hello, so for the past several months now any time i set a custom theme to my firefox browser, it'll work *until* i close the browser and re-open it, the theme goes back to dark theme. its finally starting to get on my nerves, and i thought with an update or two it would fix itself, but nope.

i have tried changing the default from automatic to dark and back again, and nothing helps. i tried looking all over google for any help relating to this issue, but the only thing i can find relating to this issue old archived reddit post where the users seem to have resolved it back then, however none of the suggestions in the thread worked for me (probably because we're now several updates past that one in the thread). please help! its very annoying to have to go in and manually change the theme every singe time i open the browser, if the feature is there it should at the least work properly!

thank you! :)
creator: jessiereina

title: Japanese characters do not render under some circumstances
content:
Japanese characters usually do not render.

I can reproduce this issue by:

  • going to the Wikipedia page for the katakana Unicode block.
  • going to any YouTube comment with Japanese text.
  • hovering over the screenshot of the YouTube comment so that the tooltip containing the name of the file is shown.

On YouTube the text renders only if 1.27916663885116563rem <= font-size <= 1.92083328962326036rem. Increasing `gfx.font_rendering.fontconfig.max_generic_substitutions` from 3 to 99 allows some punctuation to render and makes the text take up horizontal space. Further increase of the value to 999 causes the interpunct to render in the Wikipedia page.

title: ANZ Bank online banking seems to no longer be compatible with Firefox
content:
Dear Team,

ANZ Bank (Australia) no longer works with Firefox. I troubleshooted with ANZ and they say the issue is with my browser. I have the latest version of Firefox, and I have cleared my cache & history a few times. I have attached a screen shot of where the landing page hangs. The loading circle keeps rotating, but it never loads any further.

Safari & Chrome both load the page fine with no issues.

Just letting you know in case you can sort this out.

Many thanks, Mark Harvey harvey@bigpond.net.au

title: Google Image Tools NOT Working
content: I go onto google. I search for an image, select the "tools" tab and I attempt to click on any of the options (like image size, for example). The tabs simply don't work. I've cleared my cache, cleared cookies, FireFox is up-to-date, I restarted my PC. I shouldn't have to go through a hassle for something this *simple*. I used to love Mozilla, but y'all keep breaking things. Chrome is no issue, Edge is even faster now. What's the point of using this junk? YouTube pages have been freezing as well. Ima have to switch browsers and I'm definitely going to make sure no one I know sticks with FireFox.
